# dokploy_application (Data Source)

Fetches a single Dokploy application by its ID.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the application.

### Read-Only

- `app_name` (String) The app name used for Docker container naming.
- `application_status` (String) Current status: idle, running, done, or error.
- `auto_deploy` (Boolean) Whether auto-deploy is enabled.
- `branch` (String) GitHub branch name.
- `build_type` (String) The build type: dockerfile, heroku_buildpacks, paketo_buildpacks, nixpacks, static, or railpack.
- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the application was created.
- `custom_git_branch` (String) Branch for custom Git repository.
- `custom_git_url` (String) Custom Git repository URL.
- `description` (String) Description of the application.
- `docker_image` (String) Docker image name (for docker source type).
- `environment_id` (String) The environment ID this application belongs to.
- `name` (String) The display name of the application.
- `owner` (String) GitHub repository owner.
- `registry_url` (String) Docker registry URL.
- `replicas` (Number) Number of replicas.
- `repository` (String) GitHub repository name.
- `server_id` (String) Server ID the application is deployed to.
- `source_type` (String) The source type: github, gitlab, bitbucket, gitea, git, docker, or drop.
- `traefik_config` (String) Custom Traefik configuration for the application.
